- Hospital admission essential

- Antimicrobial = therapeutic emergency

- Choice of antimicrobial: ''probabilistic depending on the suspected clinical route of entry''.

- Parenteral antimicrobial initially

- Bactericide or fungicide

- Combinations (dual therapy) have limited indications, mainly to broaden the spectrum of treatments.

- Antimicrobial treatment is secondarily adapted to :

* Direct examination of blood cultures (Gram stain)
* Species identification
* Antibiotic susceptibility testing / antifungal susceptibility testing

question.title: What is the initial approach to antimicrobial treatment in bacteremia/fungemia?

option_a.title: Parenteral antimicrobial initially, followed by oral therapy

option_b.title: Parenteral antimicrobial initially, followed by direct examination of blood cultures

option_c.title: Parenteral antimicrobial initially, followed by species identification

option_d.title: Parenteral antimicrobial initially, followed by antibiotic susceptibility testing

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
